info.description: The Circle of the Fittest subclass from D&D Wiki, created by user "Rallyzydap'w", with contributions from users "Yanied", and "SirSprinkles."
info.author: D&D Wiki

description.p: Those who follow this circle believe that Nature destroys what is weak and absorbs what is strong enough to survive.

p.i: "While other druids look The Arcane Magic with bad eyes, you embrace it. Where they see a monstrosity destroying the wildlife, you see a beautiful griffon feeding. For you, it's just Nature following its course...

description.p: When you start to follow this circle in the 2nd level, you can improve your abilities by drawing power from The Weave. You learn one Eldritch Invocation from the Warlock class. You can change your invocation when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can change your invocation when you finish a long rest.

description.p: When you gain this feature at level 2, you understand that shaping metal to make tools is something that the civilized species evolves to do, so you can use metal armor and shield. You also gain proficiency with heavy armor.

Also at level 2, you know that the "Monsters" are just a part of Nature. You can use your Wild Shape to assume the shape of monstrosity types, in addition to beasts, so long as they fit the CR guidelines appropriate for your level.

sheet.description: You can use your Wild Shape to assume the shape of monstrosity types, in addition to beasts, so long as they fit the CR guidelines appropriate for your level.

description.p: At level 6, your body is more resistant and doesn't need to rest like the others. You gain the trance elven feature and proficiency in Constitution saving throws.

sheet.description: You donâ€™t need to sleep. Instead, you meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day.

description.p: You learn more about the invocations. At level 10 you learn to have three Eldritch Invocations and can change them when you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You learn to have three Eldritch Invocations and can change them when you finish a short or long rest.

description.p: When you reach level 14 you can deal with any condition affecting you. While out of combat you regain a number of hit points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). You also can't be paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, and are immune to disease.
